alert.note: Alert for Baltimore; Cecil (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 6:48PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northeast and northern Maryland, including the following counties, in northeast Maryland, Cecil. In northern Maryland, Baltimore and Harford. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 645 PM EST, River gauges indicated that flooding is ongoing. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - The stream gauge along Beaverdam Run near Cockeysville may rise to moderate flood stage in the next hour given continued heavy rains. At moderate flood stage, floodwaters begin to cover York Rd. Businesses north of Beaver Run Rd. and east of York Rd. are flooded. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cockeysville... Elkton... Aberdeen... Havre De Grace... Aberdeen Proving Ground... Calvert... Bel Air South... Randallstown... Owings Mills... Bel Air North... Eldersburg... Reisterstown... Mays Chapel... Timonium... Fallston... Riverside... Kingsville... North East... Pleasant Hills... Jarrettsville... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
